alert.note: Alert for Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Aroostook County through 530 PM EDT... At 439 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Reed Plantation, or 19 miles southeast of Patten, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sherman, Amity, Haynesville, Reed Plantation, Cary Plantation, Weston, Reed, Orient, Macwahoc, Bancroft, Glenwood, Silver Ridge, Forkstown, Benedicta, North Amity, Monarda and Molunkus. This includes US Highway 1 between Orient and North Amity. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
